title: btctodamon
author: btctodamon
content: Vigilance, awareness, and sound security procedures are all necessary for scammer protection. Here are some of the finest defences against con artistsLearn for Yourself Your strongest line of defence is knowledge. Keep up with typical fraud schemes and techniques. The more information you have, the easier it will be to spot and prevent such frauds.Check identities Never give personal or financial information to anybody without first confirming their identity. Request formal credentials and check with the organisation by contacting them through their website or other contact details.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: To sum it all up, a key strategy for safeguarding oneself from scams involves acquiring sound knowledge and adopting effective preventive measures. Often, alot of people become victims not due to a lack of awareness but rather because of their choice to disregard potential threats, believing that they are immune to fraud or phishing attempts. The escalating prevalence of cybercrime in our society today, brings about the urgency of this concern for anyone who intends to preserving the safety and security of their financial assets.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: OP there is no wrong in your post but seems obvious this is coming from a newbie who should be reading and learning more about the platform and Bitcoin. Well I have no doubt about your identity for you to have come up with these measures and I will add just a little here; do not click links you have no knowledge about both on email, social media. Avoid airdrops and unnecessary free giveaways. Do not authorise any connections online with your wallet. Anybody that PM's you claiming to be an agent block them as they are scammers. Do not spend your coin to anybody for exchange or transaction without a reputable escrow here. I believe these few tips could help you through your journey here.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: btctodamon on October 13, 2023, 04:29:45 PMVigilance, awareness, and sound security procedures are all necessary for scammer protection. Here are some of the finest defences against con artistsLearn for Yourself Your strongest line of defence is knowledge. Keep up with typical fraud schemes and techniques. The more information you have, the easier it will be to spot and prevent such frauds.Check identities Never give personal or financial information to anybody without first confirming their identity. Request formal credentials and check with the organisation by contacting them through their website or other contact details.The scammers will always try their best to find ways to scam us and I believe education and awareness about those scammers is the best defensive weapon that we can use to protect ourselves from their negative intentions. A few days ago I received a message on my number where a scammer send me a bank transaction message with an amount 5000 in my local currency. After a few minutes I received a call from an unknown number and it was no one else but the scammer. He said that he has sent the money unintentionally on my account and asked me to resend the money on his account.He said that he was trying to send the money to his family members in order to support them but it was mistakenly sent to my account. But fortunately I was aware about such scammers and I logged into my bank account to see that if I had received any amount on my account but I didn't received anything and I told him that I didn't received any amount from you and also said to him that I know scammers like you who use such tactics to scam others. The guy cut the call and turned off his number. Those scammers are everywhere and if we aren't aware about them then they can cause huge harm to us. The strange thing I noticed about that scammer is that he know how much money I had in my account and he send an amount that I had in my account.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: btctodamon on October 13, 2023, 04:29:45 PMVigilance, awareness, and sound security procedures are all necessary for scammer protection. The more information you have, the easier it will be to spot and prevent such frauds.Check identities Never give personal or financial information to anybody without first confirming their identity. Request formal credentials and check with the organisation by contacting them through their website or other contact details.Protecting your wallet is very essential because little errors can lead to loss of funds. Firstly we should avoid centralized wallets or platforms because this can easily lead to loss of funds. Use open-sourced decentralized wallets and your seed phrase and password are sensitive,  it should be handled secretly and carefully. We should also learn not to click on unusual links, every piece of information should be verified. Let's always watch out for phishing scams through social media and emails. It is also important to avoid greed because scammers promise tempting rewards that are difficult to refuse. Don't invest in a project that promises huge profit, this is a sign of a scam project.

comments.author: BitcoinPanther
comments.body: Scammer often targets a person's greed so we better check the offers if it is too good to be true.  We should control our greed and don't let greed invade our minds and rationality.  Aside from that, If the person is overpromising then it is more likely a scam.  The typical strategy of a scammer is insane interest rate or insane profit and the need to act quickly due to their limited time offers that put their victim in the state of urgency thus, disabling the capability of the victim to act rationally. This means, we need to be calm and vigilant at all time.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: Sometimes, if we can pay much attention to some things that are happening around us, we can be able to detect a simple fraud that doesn't even require any technicality in order for them to be able to figure them out. What we just need is to be able to avoid being too greedy and falling for some kind of cheap scam; avoid people who promise to give us free money, as there is no free money anywhere on the internet; avoid clicking on any link from where we are not expecting them; and we should always take warnings from our security providers, either on our PC or on our mobile, and also from security experts.And when the security is about crypto, we should always avoid all these airdrop sites that will want us to connect our wallet to their site in order for us to be able to withdraw what they promise us as a reward, which might make us land ourselves into losing the little that we manage to have.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: You made some good points, I will also add that greed is the main reason why people fall victim to scams. Scammers are not excessively brilliant, they repeat the same old tricks which is to give their target the illusion of making profit off the scammer. The greatest lie scammers invented was to make their victims believe that they were in control and that the other party was at their mercy. Just like @SamReomo told us, the scammer contacted him with a narrative that puts him at the mercy of SamReomo, some scammers would go ahead to ask you to send half of the supposed money and keep the rest to yourself. They understand that greed is every person’s blind spot and people throw away all logic and reasoning when they become greedy.

The more information you have, the easier it will be to spot and prevent such frauds.I want to underscore the importance of being part and actively involved in the cryptocurrency community. This in itself would help you stay up-to-date with the latest scam projects or new techniques and strategies used by hackers. In one of the crypto WhatsApp group which I am involved in , we were told that one of the crypto websites had been hacked and these hackers were sending emails to users of that platform. We were warned not to open or interact with my email from that website. If I had not been a part of this community, maybe I would have fallen a victim but  being a part of the group made me learn of the hack earlier and did my best to adhere to the instructions. You get latest and up to date information about hacks, scams by being a member of this type of organization.

comments.author: Eureka_07
comments.body: Quote from: btctodamon on October 13, 2023, 04:29:45 PM<snip>You will often hear and encounter this advice repeatedly: "Beware of offers that seem 'too good to be true.'" Take a moment to carefully consider the logical processes involved in how the funds are supposed to be utilized. If the plan or proposal doesn't appear to make sense, it's wise to step away. Additionally, conduct some background checks. Search the internet to see if there have been any reports of scams related to the offer being presented to you.

comments.author: Marykeller

Request formal credentials and check with the organisation by contacting them through their website or other contact details.The scammers will always try their best to find ways to scam us and I believe education and awareness about those scammers is the best defensive weapon that we can use to protect ourselves from their negative intentions. A few days ago I received a message on my number where a scammer send me a bank transaction message with an amount 5000 in my local currency. After a few minutes I received a call from an unknown number and it was no one else but the scammer. He said that he has sent the money unintentionally on my account and asked me to resend the money on his account.He said that he was trying to send the money to his family members in order to support them but it was mistakenly sent to my account. But fortunately I was aware about such scammers and I logged into my bank account to see that if I had received any amount on my account but I didn't received anything and I told him that I didn't received any amount from you and also said to him that I know scammers like you who use such tactics to scam others. The guy cut the call and turned off his number. Those scammers are everywhere and if we aren't aware about them then they can cause huge harm to us. The strange thing I noticed about that scammer is that he know how much money I had in my account and he send an amount that I had in my account. For a scammer to know how much money you have in your account already, that's to say he got the details of your account from the customer service of your bank. Because I don't see a way a scammer can dictate or know the amount of money in a stranger's account. If not for your past idea of how scammers operate by sending fake alerts to people, I ​believe you would have fallen to the scammer method of defrauding people through claiming of sending money to their bank account. In addition, the best way to follow scammers is never to trust anyone who projects an offer that has a high return on profits. Staying away from such an offer will do a lot of good.
